linkedin_extracted_data.name: Rinkal Agrawal
linkedin_extracted_data.summary: Rinkal Agrawal is a Tech Lead at Google specializing in building products and enhancing user experiences. Previously, he served as a Software Engineer at Instagram and Robinhood, where he led significant projects including real-time data pipelines, market infrastructure, and media recommendation systems. With achievements such as improving crypto execution quality by 3% at Robinhood and increasing Instagram media views by 9%, he combines technical expertise in distributed systems with a passion for product innovation. He holds a Bachelor's in Computer Science.

experience.description: Leads the Search Home Team, overseeing technical strategy and development initiatives.
Worked on the Google Search Home Team contributing to core search functionalities.

Led real-time market data support to launch crypto coins including Shiba Inu. Designed a 24/7 crypto data pipeline improving execution quality by 3%, built standalone infrastructure using Kafka, Redis, and Postgres, and supported IPO Access features with custom cron jobs for stock data.

Launched media recommendations on Instagram feed increasing views by 9%. Led political content filtering for US elections reducing recommendations by 97%, built user sentiment surveys, owned feed integrity, and revamped on-call alerting saving 5 hours/week.
Enhanced legacy applications via SNMP batching (4x efficiency gains) and automated device activation cutting time from 30 to 10 minutes.

projects.name: Autonomous Quadcopter Drone
projects.description: Collaborated with Professor Sanjai Rayadurgam to replace hardware/software systems, installing pixhawk hardware with NASA software to achieve drone autonomy.

projects.name: VideoAnt Website Redesign
projects.description: Redesigned the VideoAnt platform to enable users to add subtitles to online videos via URL integrations.

projects.name: Android Sensor Visualization App
projects.description: Designed and implemented UI components for an Android app that visualized real-time field sensor data using AWS infrastructure.
